DOTr says there s negotiation to rent 2GO ships; Dennis Uy says it s intended for donation tag:gmanetwork.com:news_story-735280 https://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/nation/735280/dotr-says-there-s-negotiation-to-rent-2go-ships-dennis-uy-says-it-s-intended-for-donation/story/ The Department of Transportation (DOTr) and 2GO Group Inc. chairman Dennis Uy have issued contradicting statements regarding the P35-million rent for the use of the logistics firm s vessels as floating quarantine facilities for COVID-19 patients. Thu, 23 Apr 2020 14:25:43 +0800
House leader wants mass registration for Nat'l ID System to start June 30 tag:gmanetwork.com:news_story-735279 https://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/nation/735279/house-leader-wants-mass-registration-for-nat-l-id-system-to-start-june-30/story/ Deputy Speaker Mikee Romero is urging the government to start the mass registration for the National ID System, which could be used to identify who can go out of their homes amid COVID-19 quarantine measures, not later than June 30 this year. Thu, 23 Apr 2020 14:24:15 +0800
Manila to assert sovereign rights in West Philippine Sea amid COVID-19 crisis -- Palace tag:gmanetwork.com:news_story-735275 https://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/nation/735275/manila-to-assert-sovereign-rights-in-west-philippine-sea-amid-covid-19-crisis-palace/story/ “Ang filing ng diplomatic protest ginagawa po yan basta kinakailangang gawin, ke may COVID ke wala, tayo po y mananatili na pu-protektahan at itataguyod ang ating national territory at ang ating sovereign rights,” presidential spokesperson Harry Roque said when asked about the timing of the protest. Thu, 23 Apr 2020 13:54:17 +0800
DOH: 500 Philippine patients to join initial trial of drugs vs. COVID-19 tag:gmanetwork.com:news_story-735274 https://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/nation/735274/doh-500-philippine-patients-to-join-initial-trial-of-drugs-vs-covid-19/story/ There will be 500 patients in the Philippines who would be joining a solidarity trial of drugs against coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19), according to the Department of Health (DOH) on Thursday. Thu, 23 Apr 2020 13:46:13 +0800
DOH prepares for typhoon-related diseases while handling COVID-19 crisis tag:gmanetwork.com:news_story-735273 https://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/nation/735273/doh-prepares-for-typhoon-related-diseases-while-handling-covid-19-crisis/story/ "Mayroon tayong dalawang pathway--ang isa 'yung COVID pathway at non-COVID pathway. Ating ine-educate ang ating local governments na dapat mayroon din silang pathway for the non-COVID services," Health Undersecretary Maria Rosario Vergeire said in a virtual conference. "Ito 'yung mga sakit o ibang mga services na dapat i-offer pa rin ng ating healthcare in spite of us having this crisis with COVID at kasama na diyan 'yung dengue," she added. Thu, 23 Apr 2020 13:46:09 +0800
DILG urges PNP to protect barangay officials from harassment of ECQ violators tag:gmanetwork.com:news_story-735272 https://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/nation/735272/dilg-urges-pnp-to-protect-barangay-officials-from-harassment-of-ecq-violators/story/ "Kami ay nakipag-ugnayan na rin sa Philippine National Police, nakiusap po kami at nagbigay ng direktiba si Secretary Eduardo Año sa Philippine National Police na bantayan o kaya naman ay suportahan ang ating mga barangay officials, protektahan sila sa mga ganitong klaseng insidente," DILG spokesman Undersecretary Jonathan Malaya said at a Laging Handa press briefing. Thu, 23 Apr 2020 13:38:12 +0800
Filipino-Chinese community imports P200M of meds, testing kits, PPEs for donations tag:gmanetwork.com:news_story-735271 https://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/nation/735271/filipino-chinese-community-imports-p200m-of-meds-testing-kits-ppes-for-donations/story/ The Filipino-Chinese community, through the Federation of Filipino-Chinese Chamber and Industry (FFCCI), said Thursday it has imported P200 million worth medical supplies for COVID-19 response. Thu, 23 Apr 2020 13:31:49 +0800
'Huge lab' to be set up in Region 3 expected to run 3k to 5k COVID-19 tests daily in May tag:gmanetwork.com:news_story-735270 https://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/nation/735270/huge-lab-to-be-set-up-in-region-3-expected-to-run-3k-to-5k-covid-19-tests-daily-in-may/story/ A laboratory capable of running 3,000 to 5,000 coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) tests daily that will be set up in Central Luzon is expected to be operational in May, the Department of Health (DOH) said Thursday. Thu, 23 Apr 2020 13:24:50 +0800
Cotabato allots nearly P1-B rice subsidy to poor families tag:gmanetwork.com:news_story-735269 https://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/regions/735269/cotabato-allots-nearly-p1-b-rice-subsidy-to-poor-families/story/ The Cotabato provincial local government has allotted nearly P1 billion for rice and vegetable subsidy to at least 400,000 poor households in the province for six months -from April until September this year -as residents are placed under quarantine due to the coronavirus disease 2019 threat. Thu, 23 Apr 2020 13:22:31 +0800
FLAG to PNP: Reconsider arrest-without-warning order tag:gmanetwork.com:news_story-735268 https://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/nation/735268/flag-to-pnp-reconsider-arrest-without-warning-order/story/ A group of human rights lawyers has urged the Philippine National Police (PNP) to reconsider its order for the arrest of violators of Luzon quarantine rules "without warning," expressing concern that the directive may lead to a disregard of existing rules on arrest. Thu, 23 Apr 2020 13:17:32 +0800
DICT calls on delivery operators to partner with more commercial establishments tag:gmanetwork.com:news_story-735266 https://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/nation/735266/dict-calls-on-delivery-operators-to-partner-with-more-commercial-establishments/story/ The Department of Information and Communications Technology (DICT) on Thursday called on delivery operators to partner with more commercial establishments amid the enhanced community quarantine (ECQ) placed over Luzon. Thu, 23 Apr 2020 13:00:21 +0800
CHR: Not for police to say if Ragos shooting is justified tag:gmanetwork.com:news_story-735265 https://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/metro/735265/not-for-police-to-say-if-ragos-shooting-is-justified/story/ “We reiterate our call to allow the rule of law to prevail and let the scrutiny of the proper courts weigh in on the question if circumstances are justifiable to warrant the shooting which eventually resulted to death,” CHR spokesperson and lawyer Jacqueline de Guia said in a statement. Thu, 23 Apr 2020 12:54:49 +0800
League of Provinces head proposes delay in opening of classes until October tag:gmanetwork.com:news_story-735264 https://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/nation/735264/no-classes-until-october-league-of-provinces-head-proposes-amid-covid-19-threat/story/ The League of Provinces of the Philippines (LPP) head on Thursday suggested delaying the opening of class for three to four months or until October amid the threat of the coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19). Thu, 23 Apr 2020 12:52:26 +0800
CCTV cameras installed in QC markets to monitor social distancing tag:gmanetwork.com:news_story-735263 https://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/metro/735263/cctv-cameras-installed-in-qc-markets-to-monitor-social-distancing/story/ The Quezon City Market Development and Administration Department on Thursday installed a CCTV camera at the Balintawak Market to ensure that social distancing is observed by marketgoers. Wescom confirms China s harassment vs. Philippine Navy vessel in February tag:gmanetwork.com:news_story-735260 https://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/nation/735260/wescom-confirms-china-s-harassment-vs-philippine-navy-vessel-in-february/story/ "This hostile act on the part of Chinese government and encroachment within the Philippines EEZ is perceived as a clear violation of international law and Philippine sovereignty," Armed Forces Western Command chief Vice Admiral Rene Medina said.
